Reviews.Content: Have to Agree Stayed here as part of a tour by Carrani September 08.Have to agree with Deeny D the meals were appalling considering we were sold the tour as a four star option.The breakfast was minimal with no cooked foods.The hotel itself was good but a little out of the way.
Reviews.Author: perfectwave

Reviews.Content: disgusting food We were with Carrani tours, lovely rooms but a very poor food dining. Dinner disgusting(the main course each night was ineditable), breakfast a limited selection
Reviews.Author: dennydNewZealand

Reviews.Content: a very decent but not enchanting stay In a city like Florence I expected to stay in a more traditional and picturesque hotel. This was just another hotel with no special character, for groups, and tourists that do not necessarily seek adventure... Despite the first negative impression, though, I found it a very decent and comfortable place, quiet, with good service. The rooms are quite spacious and very clean. Well located, not far from the old town. Decent meals. Make sure you have a room overlooking the garden in the front -the other side is rather noisy...
Reviews.Author: Argen

Reviews.Content: Great Accomodations at the Hotel Raffaello! Most excellent lodging experience! Large flat screen TV in room. Spacious bathroom by European standards with a great shower. Comfortable beds for a good night's sleep after a busy site-seeing day. Friendly, helpful staff. Easy to catch bus to downtown Florence. A must stay hotel while in Florence!
Reviews.Author: HotlantaSportsFan

Reviews.Content: Tour Operators Report - Great Hotel I have been booking groups into this hotel now for several years and always receive very positive reports back from our clients. I recently escorted a group personally to the hotel and can back-up all the excellent reviews receivedRecent comments include the following:-Great Hotel, very helpful staff, nice breakfast, clean comfortable rooms, very accessible by public transport into the historic centre, can't wait to come back, comes highly recommended, very impressed, great value for money...... So for anyone considering this hotel, then all I can say is that we rate a hotel from feedback received and 99% of our clients have been more than happy with the quality and service received at the Raffaello Hotel, Florence
Reviews.Author: LJLeisure

Reviews.Content: thanks, and we will be back HiI have just returned from staying three days at the hotel raffaello,it was a suprise present from my wife,they were three wonderful days,we found we were looked after as if we were royals,staff extremly polite and helpful,room was everything you could want, clean, air conditioned, and a new flat screen tv (with english tv), a bathroom with so many towels we could have stayed a month and had 10 showers a day,and a very nice breakfast with a good choice, unfortunatly we didn't try the restaurant but will do the next time. We were even introduced to the manager and with being a hotel of this size we felt even more like royals but later found out that the manager a Mr Torigiani is always this friendly with his guests, congragulations keep up the good work and hope to be back next year,this time I will treat my wife.R  L Burrows
Reviews.Author: rabu

Reviews.Content: Brendan/Globus need to delete this hotel On a nine-day tour, this was the only hotel that was disappointing. The dinner and the breakfast buffet were dismal, at best. Although we were warned by our tour guide that the food was not very good. The rooms were shabby and the walls were so thin you could hear every word spoken in the adjoining rooms. The furniture, furnishings, toiletries, towels, etc. were very cheap. Out of a group of 37, most of our travelers complained about the beds being so hard it was difficult to sleep. The icing on the cake was when a big bug crawled across my bed and woke me up in the middle of the night. On a brighter note, the staff was very helpful and professional. My advice is to pay a little extra and find a better hotel.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Not 4 "American" stars for sure, but... We stayed at the Raffaello Hotel as part of our Globus tour. The room and bathroom size were adequate. There was mold in the shower but there's probably mold in my shower at home. It was clean (no hair, trash, dirty toilet, etc.) when we arrived. The beds were terribly hard. I like a firm mattress but this was like sleeping on a slab of marble. It was obivous that our room was a smoking one, although there were no ashes left behind, just the stale smell of smoke. Please note that in April, there is no air conditioning (the temps were in the 70's) and your room key placed in the slot on the wall beside the door, turns on the lights. The breakfast provided was okay but the group dinner provided by the hotel was very blah. It was like an Americanized version of Italian food. We were in Tuscany, we wanted real Tuscan food! In sum, the food was disappointing. The hotel is some distance from the historical center of Florence. Some people in our group took the bus as the center of town was not walkable. We wouldn't stay here if we had the choice. It just didn't work for what we would want if we were on our own. If you go with a group, here's what you can expect.
Reviews.Author: cbkingery

Reviews.Content: Mold in the shower! Of the 3 hotels we stayed in with our Globus tour, this was the worst hotel. I had called Globus prior to the tour because of these posted comments, and was assured the hotel had been upgraded. We found the bathroom with mold in the shower, the carpeting was dirty, no air ventilation and lots of mosquitoes when we opened the windows for air. Plus the waitresses were rude and the food was poor! I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, and for Globus, pay attention to your paying customers and make a change in hotels here.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Not bad, but... The rooms were clean, however the air conditioning is shut off at night. Not very pleasant ! The food is not so good, and the waitresses were down right rude !!!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Ok, but Not 4 Stars I think the hotel must have improved some since some of these reviews, but it wasn't great. Our Carrani tour put us up there as saying it was a four star hotel. The room and shower were nice enough, but the bed was indeed too firm. I thought breakfast was fairly adequate and the staff was nice as well. I think the Raffaello must be inexpensive for a 4 star which is why Carrani put us there. The reason it's probably less expensive is because it's not near the historical part of Florence at all which is sad. Also, there were constant sirens both nights we were there so I suspect there is a very busy hospital nearby. So the location isn't great.
Reviews.Author: Darshan1

Reviews.Content: Four stars quality for a small price We ended up at the Hotel Raffaello on the recommendation of an American friend of ours who lives in Italy. The room was smartly decorated but not deluxe. The front-desk staff spoke fairly good English and the manager, who also spoke very good English, was helpful in giving us tips on restaurants nearby. Also the Hotel's restaurant was a nice surprise, good service, good wine and very good food. We were happy with the quality of the service for the price we paid.We recommend
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Old, dirty Raffaello Yes, we stayed at Hotel Raffaello because it was part of our Globus Tour. It says it is a 5 star hotel, but i think it needs to seriously re evaluate its standards! the lobby was old fashioned, and the rooms small and dirty looking. It was very dull, and the bathroom looked dirty. The 'buffet breakfast' was very simple, with nothing much to eat. Out of the three 4 hotels we stayed in Italy, this was the worst. Do yourself a favour and don't go to Hotel Raffaello!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: very bad hotel Bad location even worst rooms. We were forced to this hotel becasue we booked with Globos tour conpany. I was the worst of the three hotels we stayed in ITALY. Definately a no no.
Reviews.Author: h3kamal

Reviews.Content: Lousy Hotel!!! The hotel was as bad as everyone states.The first thing; bed was so hard that the two nights we stayed there with our tour group, the following morning everyone would complain about their back. I got a pinch nerve from that lousy bed! The food was lousy. I have never had such terrible coffee in my lifetime like I did at this hotel. Stay elsewhere!!!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Not the best The lobby is misleading, because when one enters it, you think you are staying at a nice hotel. The bathroom was dirty with mildew and mold in the shower. The blanket that was in the closet had a long hair on it, indicating that it wasn't washed between guests. The continental breakfast was very skimpy to say the least. I realize continental breakfast doesn't mean a full breakfast, but this was ridiculous. We ate at 2 other hotels on our tour in other Italy cities and got marvelous continental breakfasts. Overall, it was lucky that Floence is such a beautiful place, that one doesn't spend that much time at a hotel- only to sleep.
Reviews.Author: Mickeym0use

Reviews.Content: Not a great hotel This hotel does not create a good impression from the moment one enters the foyer - it is full of smoke. Then onto the bar - there are these hideous green velvet lounges which are in dire need of update and rejuvenation. Then the rooms, the shower is OK; if you're 13 years old and border on the skinny side. I shouldn't complain too much though, the small bathroom is so tiny that one can brush one's teeth whilst using the toilet (yep it is THAT close to the wash basin).The rooms could also do with an update and upgrade and worst of all - the walls are paper-thin we could hear the couple next door, particularly the man's snoring. Then the food: at dinner we were treated with butter that was off (it had a bitter taste to it - butter, when fresh, should have a neutral taste). At breakfast we could enjoy: cold hard-boiled eggs, stale croissants, minimal cereals, and the off butter from dinner the night before. Yep, steer clear from this hotel.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Avoid this Hotel! We recently visited Florence, and had the misfortune to stay in this hotel. On checkin, we noted that there were plug-in devices in the ashtrays, and soon learned that they were electronic mosquito repellent. We found this perplexing as the room was air conditioned. It began to make sense when the A/C was tunred off at midnight. We called the front desk and were told that it was broken. When we requested another room, we were told that the air conditioning was broken in the whole hotel. Miraculously however, service was restored at 6am. One of our travelling companions returned from a morning run to find her room alive with ants. To cap the stay, a remarkably arrogant front desk clerk refused to cash our travellers checks, calling into question the authenticity of the signatures! If you want ot enjoy your visit to Venice, do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
